topic.title: How to Add a Google+ Button in WebHelp Responsive Output

body.p: It is possible to integrate Google into your WebHelp Responsive output and you can specify where you want the widget to appear in your WebHelp page.

section.title: Using Oxygen XML Editor/Author
section.p:
To add a Google+ widget to your WebHelp Responsive output using a transformation scenario from within Oxygen XML Editor/Author, follow this procedure: Go to the Google Developers website. Fill-in the displayed form. The preview area on the right side displays the code and a preview of the widget. Copy the code snippet displayed in the preview area and paste it into a div element inside an XML file called google-plus-button.xml. Make sure that the content of the file is well-formed. The content of the XML file should look like this:
In Oxygen XML Editor/Author, click the Configure Transformation Scenario(s) action from the toolbar (or the Document Transformation menu. Select an existing WebHelp Responsive transformation scenario (depending on your needs, it may be with or without feedback) and click the Duplicate button to open the Edit Scenario dialog box. Switch to the Parameters tab. Depending on where you want to display the button, edit one of the parameters that begin with webhelp.fragment. Set that parameter to reference the google-plus-button.xml file that you created earlier. Click Ok and run the transformation scenario.

section.title: Using a Script Outside of Oxygen XML Editor/Author

section.p:
To add a Google+ widget to your WebHelp Responsive output using a script outside of Oxygen XML Editor/Author, follow this procedure: Go to the Google Developers website. Fill-in the displayed form. The preview area on the right side displays the code and a preview of the widget. Copy the code snippet displayed in the preview area and paste it into a div element inside an XML file called google-plus-button.xml. Make sure that the content of the file is well-formed. The content of the XML file should look like this:
Use one of the parameters that begin with webhelp.fragment in your transformation script. Set the value of that parameter to reference the google-plus-button.xml file that you created earlier. Execute the transformation script. For example: Windows: dita.bat -i c:\mySample.ditamap -f webhelp-responsive -Dwebhelp.fragment.after.toc_or_tiles=c:\google-plus-button.xml Mac OS X/ Linux: dita -i C:/mySample.ditamap -f webhelp-responsive -Dwebhelp.fragment.after.toc_or_tiles=C:/google-plus-button.xml
